item.title: NYT Connections Hints Today (#977)—Answers for Thursday, February 122
item.content:encoded:
You’ve almost made it to the end of the week, but let us know in the comments how your NYT Connections streak is keeping up. Are you in double digits? Triple? Regardless of where you’re at, I’ve got the NYT Connections hints and solutions you need below to keep pushing that count up!

Read on to get today’s NYT Connections answers as quickly as possible.

How to Play NYT Connections

In June 2023, NYT Connections emerged as yet another game in the ever-growing New York Times lineup. This title soared immediately, and it’s easy to see why. As a free-to-play, accessible New York Times game, NYT Connections is available to users worldwide and can be played on either desktop devices or via a mobile app.

But how do you play NYT Connections?

The NYT team will provide you with a grid of 16 words once a day. The only task left up to you is to sort those words into four groups of four by finding their commonalities. Every NYT Connections puzzle has just one solution, and some words might have a double meaning, so it can sometimes be tricky to figure out the answers.

It’s also important to stress that the words are color-coded: yellow, blue, green, and purple. That’s in order of difficulty from least to most difficult, too.

What’s critical here is that you get four guesses every day, and if you use those, your NYT Connections answers for today will be out of reach, as it’ll be game over.

Today’s NYT Connections Hints (February 12)

Here are the words from today’s NYT Connections puzzle:

  • MAY
  • YANK
  • A
  • CARD
  • FROZEN
  • PRODUCE
  • DANCING
  • DAIRY
  • MAKE
  • JAY
  • FAST
  • FORM
  • DRAG
  • FIRM
  • MOLD
  • TIGHT

And here are the hints I can offer for today’s NYT Connections:

  • Yellow – Ways to build things
  • Green – Stuck in place
  • Blue – Abbreviate MLB teams and players
  • Purple – Words that could go before ‘queen’

Here’s the final warning before we get to the NYT Connections answers for today, February 12:

Are you sure you want to scroll further?

Very well!

NYT Connections Answers Explained for Today, February 12 (#977)

If you want to jump straight to the answers for today’s NYT Connections puzzle, I’ve got you covered:

  • Yellow – FORM, MAKE, MOLD, PRODUCE
  • Green – FAST, FIRM, FROZEN, TIGHT
  • Blue – A, CARD, JAY, YANK
  • Purple – DAIRY, DANCING, DRAG, MAY

When Does NYT Connections Reset?

That’s today’s puzzle, but if you want the next one, the game resets daily at midnight local time (that’s your local time). You’ll have 24 hours to complete the puzzle when midnight ticks over in your timezone.

How did you do? Did you get a perfect run? Let me know what your streak looks like on the Insider Gaming Discord server

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more…

More from Grant Taylor-Hill

item.title: Diablo 4 Gets Major Skill Tree Updates and More in Upcoming DLC
item.content:encoded:
Diablo 4’s Lord of Hatred DLC overhauls skill trees, adds talismans, the Horadric Cube, and introduces long-awaited loot filters.

During the 30th-anniversary Diablo presentation on February 11, it was announced that the Warlock class was coming to 3 Diablo games, including Diablo 4.

Additionally, it was announced that major updates would overhaul parts of Diablo 4, with the Lord of Hatred update coming in April. One of those updates is a major change to how skill trees work.

The team even joked about hearing players call skill trees “skill twigs,” but that is coming to an end.

“We’re adding new customization options to every single skill across the entire tree,” they revealed. “It isn’t just a small tweak, it’s a major disruption to the current class system.”

Skill Tree Updates Are Coming to Every Class in Diablo 4

It was stated that every class will receive skill tree updates with more than 40 choices and over 80 additional options. Those who purchased the Lord of Hatred DLC will have 20 additional transformative skill options.

Plus, they’re introducing talismans, which will add even more adjustments to your characters. The DLC is also introducing the Horadric Cube, another way to continue shaping your endgame journey. They also excitedly announced that loot filters are finally being added to give players more control over their items.

For more Diablo, check out Warlocks coming to Diablo 2, giving that game its first update in 25 years.

How excited are you about the upcoming changes to Diablo 4? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Diablo 2 Gets First Major Update and New Class in 25 Years
item.content:encoded:
Warlocks have come to the world of Diablo 2 as the game has received its first major update in a quarter of a century.

Blizzard Entertainment announced the Reign of the Warlock DLC during a presentation spotlighting 30 years of Diablo. The trailer featured actor Rahul Kohli from Midnight Mass. Kohli narrated the trailer from the Warlock’s point of view in the update that is now available for Diablo 2: Resurrected.

Warlocks Are Coming to Multiple Diablo Games

In addition to coming to Diablo 2, the Warlock class is also coming to Diablo 4 and Diablo Immortal. The Immortal update will be available this summer, and the Diablo 4 update will be available in April 2026.

As another teaser, the Blizzard staff featured in the presentation teased a major announcement coming for BlizzCon this September.

Along with the update, the game is now available on Xbox Game Pass and PC on Steam. The announcement of the new class on Steam came with a note from the development team that they are aware of issues impacting players:

“We are aware of an issue impacting Diablo II: Resurrected Infernal Edition bonus incentives for Diablo IV and World of Warcraft, where some players who purchase on Steam may not see these items unlock immediately. Our team is actively working on a fix, and eligible rewards will automatically unlock once resolved,” the statement reads.

How do you feel about Diablo 2 getting a new class after a quarter of a century? What do you think the major announcement for BlizzCon will be? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
